meanings.definition: Present or represented in a fictional form.
meanings.sent1: The fictionalised story was full of exciting adventures.
meanings.sent2: The book had a fictionalised character who could fly.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed the fictionalised tale before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination created a whole fictionalised world.
meanings.sent5: The movie brought to life a beautifully fictionalised universe.

meanings.definition: To make into fiction; to adapt or portray as fiction.
meanings.sent1: She fictionalised her own experiences in her novel.
meanings.sent2: The author fictionalised historical events to create a compelling story.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly fictionalised his daily commute as a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent4: The artist fictionalised reality into a dreamlike painting.
meanings.sent5: The playwright fictionalised the true story to captivate the audience.
